standard_metadata.standard_description: Read and write multi-digit whole numbers using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form. Compare two multi-digit numbers based on meanings of the digits in each place, using >, =, and < symbols to record the results of comparisons.

question.content: **Regroup to express the number in a different way.**   |  | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :- $9{,}150$ | $=$ | $9 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $1\text{ hundred}$ | $+$| $5 \text{ tens}$ $9{,}150$ | $=$ | $8 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$|   | $+$| $5 \text{ tens}$

hints.content: $\green{9}{,}150$ is composed of:   $\green{9 \text{ thousands}} + 1  \text{ hundred} + 5 \text{ tens}$.     We can use place value to express this in a different way.

$\green{9 \text{ thousands}}$ can be written as $\blue{8 \text{ thousands} + 1 \text{ thousand}}$.    So, $\green{9 \text{ thousands}} + 1 \text{ hundred}$ can be regrouped this way:    $\green{9 \text{ thousands}} + 1 \text{ hundred}$   $\begin{align} &=\blue{8 \text{ thousands} + 1 \text{ thousand}} + 1 \text{ hundred}\\ &= 8 \text{ thousands} + 10 \text{ hundreds} + 1 \text{ hundred}\\ &= 8 \text{ thousands} + \purple{11} \text{ hundreds}.\end{align}$  The other digit will not change.

|  | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :- $9{,}150$ | $=$ | $9 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $1\text{ hundred}$ | $+$| $5 \text{ tens}$ $9{,}150$ | $=$ | $8 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$|$\maroonD{11\text{ hundreds}}$  | $+$| $5 \text{ tens}$

question.content: **Regroup to express the number in a different way.**   |  | | | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :-| :- | :- $16{,}590$ | $=$ | $1\text{ ten thousand}$ | $+$| $6\text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $5\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $9\text{ tens}$ $16{,}590$ | $=$ | $1\text{ ten thousand}$ | $+$ | $6 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$|  $4\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$|

hints.content: $16{,} \green{5}90$ is composed of: $1 \text{ ten thousand} + 6 \text{ thousands} + \green{5\text{ hundreds}} + 9\text{ tens}$.     We can use place value to express this in a different way.

$\green{5\text{ hundreds}}$ can be written as $\blue{4\text{ hundreds} + 1\text{ hundred}}$.  So, $\green{5\text{ hundreds}} + 9\text{ tens}$ can be regrouped this way:    $\green{5\text{ hundreds}} + 9 \text{ tens}$   $\begin{align}&=\blue{4\text{ hundreds} + 1\text{ hundred}} + 9\text{ tens}\\ &= 4 \text{ hundreds} + 10 \text{ tens} + 9\text{ tens}\\ &= 4 \text{ hundreds} + \purple{19} \text{ tens}. \end{align}$  The other digits will not change.

|  | | | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :-| :- | :- $16{,}590$ | $=$ | $1\text{ ten thousand}$ | $+$| $6\text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $5\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $9\text{ tens}$ $16{,}590$ | $=$ | $1\text{ ten thousand}$ | $+$ | $6 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$|  $4\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $\maroonD{19\text{ tens}}$

question.content: **Regroup to express the number in a different way.**   |  | | | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :-| :- | :- $71{,}830$ | $=$ | $7\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$| $1\text{ thousand}$ | $+$| $8\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $3\text{ tens}$ $71{,}830$ | $=$ | $6\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$ |  | $+$|  $8\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $3\text{ tens}$

hints.content: $\green{7}1{,}830$ is composed of:   $\green{7 \text{ ten thousands}} + 1 \text{ thousand} + 8  \text{ hundreds} + 3 \text{ tens}$.     We can use place value to express this in a different way.

$\green{7 \text{ ten thousands}}$ can be written as $\blue{6 \text{ ten thousands} + 1 \text{ ten thousand}}$.    So, $\green{7 \text{ ten thousands}} + 1 \text{ thousand}$ can be regrouped this way:  $\green{7 \text{ ten thousands}} + 1 \text{ thousand}$   $\begin{align}&=\blue{6 \text{ ten thousands} + 1 \text{ ten thousand}} + 1 \text{ thousand}\\ &= 6 \text{ ten thousands} + 10 \text{ thousands} + 1 \text{ thousand}\\ &= 6 \text{ ten thousands} + \purple{11} \text{ thousands}. \end{align}$  The other digits will not change.

|  | | | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :-| :- | :- $71{,}830$ | $=$ | $7\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$| $1\text{ thousand}$ | $+$| $8\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $3\text{ tens}$ $71{,}830$ | $=$ | $6\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$ |$\maroonD{11\text{ thousands}}$ | $+$|  $8\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $3\text{ tens}$

question.content: **Regroup to express the number in a different way.**   |  | | | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :-| :- | :- $73{,}250$ | $=$ | $7\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$| $3\text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $2\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $5\text{ tens}$ $73{,}250$ | $=$ | $7\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$ | $3\text{ thousands}$ | $+$|  $1\text{ hundred}$ | $+$|

hints.content: $73{,}\green{2}50$ is composed of:   $7 \text{ ten thousands} + 3 \text{ thousands} + \green{2\text{ hundreds}} + 5\text{ tens}$.     We can use place value to express this in a different way.

$\green{2\text{ hundreds}}$ can be written as $\blue{1\text{ hundred} + 1\text{ hundred}}$.  So, $\green{2\text{ hundreds}} + 5\text{ tens}$ can be regrouped this way:    $\begin{align}\green{2\text{ hundreds}} + 5 \text{ tens}&=\blue{1\text{ hundred} + 1\text{ hundred}} + 5 \text{ tens}\\ &= 1 \text{ hundred} + 10 \text{ tens} + 5 \text{ tens}\\ &= 1 \text{ hundred} + \purple{15} \text{ tens}.\end{align}$  The other digits will not change.

|  | | | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :-| :- | :- $73{,}250$ | $=$ | $7\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$| $3\text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $2\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $5\text{ tens}$ $73{,}250$ | $=$ | $7\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$ | $3\text{ thousands}$ | $+$|  $1\text{ hundred}$ | $+$|$\maroonD{15\text{ tens}}$

question.content: **Regroup to express the number in a different way.**   | | | | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :-| :- | :- $57{,}270$ | $=$ | $5\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$| $7\text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $2\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $7\text{ tens}$ $57{,}270$ | $=$ | $4\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$ |  | $+$|  $2\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $7\text{ tens}$

hints.content: $\green{5}7{,}270$ is composed of:   $\green{5 \text{ ten thousands}} + 7 \text{ thousands} + 2\text{ hundreds} + 7\text{ tens}$.     We can use place value to express this in a different way.

$\green{5 \text{ ten thousands}}$ can be written as $\blue{4\text{ ten thousands} + 1\text{ ten thousand}}$.  So, $\green{5 \text{ ten thousands}} + 7\text{ thousands}$ can be regrouped this way:    $\green{5 \text{ ten thousands}} + 7 \text{ thousands}$ $\begin{align}&=\blue{4\text{ ten thousands} + 1\text{ ten thousand}} + 7 \text{ thousands}\\ &= 4 \text{ ten thousands} + 10 \text{ thousands} + 7 \text{ thousands}\\ &= 4 \text{ ten thousands} + \purple{17} \text{ thousands}. \end{align}$  The other digits will not change.

| | | | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :-| :- | :- $57{,}270$ | $=$ | $5\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$| $7\text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $2\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $7\text{ tens}$ $57{,}270$ | $=$ | $4\text{ ten thousands}$ | $+$ | $\maroonD{17\text{ thousands}}$| $+$|  $2\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $7\text{ tens}$

question.content: **Regroup to express the number in a different way.**   |  | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :- $4{,}570$ | $=$ | $4 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $5\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $7 \text{ tens}$ $4{,}570$ | $=$ | $3 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$|   | $+$| $7 \text{ tens}$

hints.content: $\green{4}{,}570$ is composed of:   $\green{4 \text{ thousands}} + 5 \text{ hundreds} + 7 \text{ tens}$.     We can use place value to express this in a different way.

$\green{4 \text{ thousands}}$ can be written as $\blue{3 \text{ thousands} + 1 \text{ thousand}}$.    So, $\green{4 \text{ thousands}} + 5 \text{ hundreds}$ can be regrouped this way:    $\green{4 \text{ thousands}} + 5 \text{ hundreds}$   $\begin{align}&=\blue{3 \text{ thousands} + 1 \text{ thousand}} + 5 \text{ hundreds}\\ &= 3 \text{ thousands} + 10 \text{ hundreds} + 5 \text{ hundreds}\\ &= 3 \text{ thousands} + \purple{15} \text{ hundreds}.\end{align}$  The other digits will not change.

|  | | | | | - | :- | :-| :-| :- $4{,}570$ | $=$ | $4 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $5\text{ hundreds}$ | $+$| $7 \text{ tens}$ $4{,}570$ | $=$ | $3 \text{ thousands}$ | $+$| $\maroonD{15\text{ hundreds}}$ | $+$| $7 \text{ tens}$

question.content: **Regroup the number to express the value in a different way.**  $4$ thousands $=$  hundreds

hints.content: $1\text{ thousand}= 10\text{ hundreds}$  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One thousands block followed by an equals sign.
Ten hundreds blocks.

hints.content: So, $\blueD4\text{ thousands}= \blueD4\times 10\text{ hundreds}$.
$4\text{ thousands}= 40\text{ hundreds}$

question.content: **Regroup the number to express the value in a different way.**  $30$ tens $=$  hundreds

hints.content: $10\text{ tens}= 1\text{ hundred}$  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: Ten tens blocks followed by an equals sign.
1 hundreds block.

hints.content: So, $\purpleC{30}\text{ tens}= \purpleC{30}\div 10\text{ hundreds}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ image 3]]  [[☃ image 4]]  [[☃ image 5]]  [[☃ image 6]]

images.alt: Ten tens blocks followed by an equals sign.
1 hundreds block.
Ten tens blocks followed by an equals sign.
1 hundreds block.
Ten tens blocks followed by an equals sign.
1 hundreds block.

hints.content: $30\text{ tens}= 3\text{ hundreds}$

question.content: **Regroup the number to express the value in a different way.**  $5$ thousands $=$  hundreds

hints.content: $1\text{ thousand}= 10\text{ hundreds}$  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One thousands block followed by an equals sign.
Ten hundreds blocks.

hints.content: So, $\blueD5\text{ thousands}= \blueD5\times 10\text{ hundreds}$.
$5\text{ thousands}= 50\text{ hundreds}$

question.content: **Regroup the number to express the value in a different way.**  $9$ hundreds $=$  tens

hints.content: $1\text{ hundred}= 10\text{ tens}$  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One hundreds block followed by an equal sign.
10 tens blocks.

hints.content: So, $\blueD9\text{ hundreds}= \blueD9\times 10\text{ tens}$.
$9\text{ hundreds}= 90\text{ tens}$

question.content: **Regroup the number to express the value in a different way.**  $20$ hundreds $=$  thousands

hints.content: $10\text{ hundreds}= 1\text{ thousand}$  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: Ten hundreds blocks followed by an equal sign.
1 thousands block.

hints.content: So, $\greenD{20}\text{ hundreds}= \greenD{20}\div 10\text{ thousands}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ image 3]]  [[☃ image 4]]

images.alt: Ten hundreds blocks followed by an equal sign.
1 thousands block.
Ten hundreds blocks followed by an equals sign.
1 thousands block.

hints.content: $20\text{ hundreds}= 2\text{ thousands}$

question.content: $1{,}900$ is $1$ thousand plus $9$ hundreds.    **Which is another way to make $1{,}900$?**

images.alt: One thousands block and 9 hundreds blocks.

hints.content: We can break up the thousand into $\greenD{10 \text{ hundreds}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One thousands block followed by an equal sign.
10 hundreds blocks.

hints.content: This leaves us with $\blueD{9\text{ hundreds}}$. Plus we have the $\greenD{10 \text{ hundreds}}$ we just broke up.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: Nine hundreds blocks followed by a plus sign.
10 hundreds blocks.

hints.content: $1{,}900$ can also be made with $19$ hundreds.

question.content: $470$ is $4$ hundreds plus $7$ tens.    **Which is another way to make $470$?**

images.alt: Four hundreds blocks and 7 tens blocks.

hints.content: We can break up one of the hundreds into $\greenD{10 \text{ tens}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One hundreds block followed by an equal sign.
10 tens blocks.

hints.content: This leaves us with $\blueD{3\text{ hundreds and }7 \text{ tens}}$. Plus we have the $\greenD{10 \text{ tens}}$ we just broke up.     [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: Three hundreds blocks and 7 tens blocks followed by a plus sign.
10 tens blocks.

hints.content: $470$ can also be made with $3$ hundreds plus $17$ tens.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Three hundreds blocks and 17 tens blocks.

question.content: $6{,}500$ is $6$ thousands plus $5$ hundreds.       **Which is another way to make $6{,}500$?**

images.alt: Four thousands blocks.
Two more thousands blocks and 5 hundreds blocks.

hints.content: We can break up one of the thousands into $\greenD{10 \text{ hundreds}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One thousands block followed by an equal sign.
10 hundreds blocks.

hints.content: This leaves us with $\blueD{5\text{ thousands and }5 \text{ hundreds}}$. Plus we have the $\greenD{10 \text{ hundreds}}$ we just broke up.  [[☃ image 3]]  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One more thousands block and 5 hundreds blocks followed by a plus sign.
10 hundreds blocks.
Four thousands blocks.

hints.content: $6{,}500$ can also be made with $5$ thousands plus $15$ hundreds.

question.content: $320$ is $3$ hundreds plus $2$ tens.    **What is another way to make $320$?**

images.alt: Three hundreds blocks and 2 tens blocks.

hints.content: We can break up one of the hundreds into $\greenD{10 \text{ tens}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One hundreds block followed by an equal sign.
10 tens blocks.

hints.content: This leaves us with $\blueD{2\text{ hundreds and }2 \text{ tens}}$. Plus we have the $\greenD{10 \text{ tens}}$ we just broke up.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]  How many hundreds and tens are there now?

images.alt: Two hundreds blocks and 2 tens blocks followed by a plus sign.
10 tens blocks.

hints.content: $320$ can also be made with $2$ hundreds plus $12$ tens.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two hundreds blocks and 12 tens blocks.

question.content: $2{,}800$ is $2$ thousands plus $8$ hundreds.    **Which is another way to make $2{,}800$?**

images.alt: Two thousands blocks and 8 hundreds blocks.

hints.content: We can break up one of the thousands into $\greenD{10 \text{ hundreds}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One thousands block followed by an equal sign.
10 hundreds blocks.

hints.content: This leaves us with $\blueD{1\text{ thousand and }8 \text{ hundreds}}$. Plus we have the $\greenD{10 \text{ hundreds}}$ we just broke up.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: One thousands block and 8 hundreds blocks followed by a plus sign.
10 hundreds blocks.

hints.content: $2{,}800$ can also be made with $1$ thousand plus $18$ hundreds.
